website_summaries.verdict: It's worth spending more for better photo quality and slightly faster print speeds.
cons: Slightly slower than its big brother

customer_reviews.title: Like the 4 ink tank system.
customer_reviews.text: I am replacing a Canon i 560 which is a very good machine and still running. The iP3000 has the 4 ink tanks and separate print head that makes good copies cheaply, like the i560. The Pixma runs about the same speed as the old i560 but the print quality is better, sharper. I have run several Canon 4 ink tank units well past their expected lifetime, (2) S400's, (2) S520's, (2) i560's. They are economical to run, they use the entire ink supply up before needing more ink, ink is cheap, the print heads last a long time, and the machine lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Bin Rydin

customer_reviews.title: A fine printer
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this printer for a couple of years now and I love it. Especially the ability to do hands-free double-sided printing (the machine prints once side, pulls it back in, turns it over, and prints the other side. Like most printers, the unit itself is low-priced and they make their money on ink sales. I haven't tried it with "refill" ink because I lost an Epson printer to that habit (clogged the emitters), but then that Epson was very fussy about ink (by design?). When I needed another printer for my wife's computer, I bought another Canon (that one with a flatbed scanner on top).
customer_reviews.author: Tank

customer_reviews.title: I love the  Cannon 1p3000
customer_reviews.text: The Cannon ip3000 is the best printer that I ever had, I love the price, the s/h, then most of all the printer is the bomb. It gives you such great color, I love the way the printer prints boths sides of the paper, my pictures are so beautiful but you must use the cannon photo paper, but that's not a big thing, be-cause when you see your photos it is well worth it. I'm thinking about getting another one for upstairs, oh and the ink useage is all that and more. This is a good printer get it you will not be sorry. oh and cannon gives you so much help with it. Zandra
customer_reviews.author: Mugga4

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer-Lots of Features
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Canon PIXMA iP3000 for mostly non photo printing. I get my photos printed at one of the warehouse stores on regular photo paper for .19 cents each. The Canon ink is inexpensive, the printer prints both sides of the paper without removing the sheet, has great software and prints internet screens without cliping the right side of the page. The printed page is excellent. The print head can be replaced by the user. I got tired of expensive ink and clogged print heads requiring factory replacement. I am very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Charles E. Kenyon

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: Have had three of these over the years and for the price it can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Walker

customer_reviews.title: It is not working for my laptop. I will ...
customer_reviews.text: It is not working for my laptop. I will try it on my PC desktop and my Mac. If the yellow light keeps blinking I have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Excellent basic printer
customer_reviews.text: This is the second iP3000 I have owned. The first one lasted 11 years and never failed until the last few months. I have been using a CIS the entire time so my printing costs have been pennies compared to using cartridges all the time. If you want a dependable basic printer I highly recommend this Canon model.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: I hardly ever had problems with it and it printed great quality photos
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer, used, in 2011 to do edible images for cakes at my business. I used it at least 2-3 times a week since. It is 2015 now and it finally bit the dust a couple weeks ago. I am very impressed at the length of time I was able to use it. I hardly ever had problems with it and it printed great quality photos! I would definitely recommend buying from this seller. Thanks for the great product!!!
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: A great printer at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer to replace an ailing Canon S520. The output is excellent, and fast, especially on color photos. This printer boasts a paper tray that can be adjusted to accept print sized photo stock as well as plain letter sized paper. Of course, to get the best results with photos you must use specialty paper. Amazon had the best pricing and the delivery was quick.
customer_reviews.author: Jetford172

customer_reviews.title: STILL TICKING!
customer_reviews.text: It's been 9 years since I purchased this and it still works as great, if not better, than when I first purchased it. Canon hit a homerun with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Somedaze.com Fan

customer_reviews.title: Canon Printer lasted a long time
customer_reviews.text: This was a great printer I purchased in 2005. I said was because I just got rid of it when I moved in July 2012! It ran its course. I never had any problems with printing photos or standard printing. I had very little paper jams, but when I did, it was easy to follow the guides to remove the paper. I always used generic ink cartridges and never had any problems with it printing.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Merrill

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Printer
customer_reviews.text: Great Prints - all kinds of paper. Printing on both sides is awesome! Ink cartridges are cheap to buy, it almost doesn't pay to re-fill - but I do anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Jarchow

customer_reviews.title: Consistant printer, reliable
customer_reviews.text: Unit worked great right out of the box. I run several of these at work and is a great printer for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Allen

customer_reviews.title: great printer
customer_reviews.text: ordered this printer on wednesday, received saturday. tested it out after easy installation of ink tanks and downloading software, which was easy to follow the instructions. used in combination with my canon A75, I'm impressed with how great a photographer I turned out to be. (joke). the pictures are sharp, colorful, and I look forward to lots of creative fun in my future wanderings around town. purchased new for $45 plus s/h. wow! from your seller Xinning. he is very helpful and great to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Tripoli

customer_reviews.title: mY PIXMA IP3000
customer_reviews.text: GREAT FIND. I LOVE THIS PARTICULAR PRINTER, AND IT SAVED MY LIFE AS I ALREADY HAD LOTS OF INK TO USE WITH THIS PRINTER.
customer_reviews.author: Alyce Cason

customer_reviews.title: Canon iP3000 meets expectations
customer_reviews.text: Printer meet my expectations. Easy to set up and prints with good quality. Also the replacement inks, non Canon are very cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Okamoto

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful printer. Text and photos alike look great. For the little amount of money to purchase, it is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: CAS

customer_reviews.title: PIXMA iP3000 Photo Printer review
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup with clear directions. Drivers installed quickly. Prints good quality prints QUICKLY!
customer_reviews.author: furiae

customer_reviews.title: Printer DOA
customer_reviews.text: The printer arrived with Amazon's usual good service, but the printer is unusable. The printer refuses to print without the inner door shut... even though the inner door is as shut as it can get. Having said that, Canon have just agreed to send out a new printer, gratis. :-( UPDATE: The second printer died six months later; Canon agreed to send out yet another printer. I'm torn between being peeved with the low robustness of the printer and marvelling at their customer service. I still wouldn't buy this printer again.
customer_reviews.author: Peter J. Kootsookos

customer_reviews.title: Great value, good quality prints!
customer_reviews.text: I have this connected to my iMac G5 and the thing works wonders. Its fast at printing b&w and for pics its pretty impressive! Although I've only printed a few pics (i do most of my digital pics at the local wally world) they came out amazing. This printer is a great value. $100 - a MIB for this fantastic printer. I highly suggest anyone looking at getting a new inkjet look at this model. Lexmark and HP for me have poor quality products for the money, plus you save more on ink using the Canon. I love how i can use the tray to feed paper in rather than go from the top. Very good printer for the money!
customer_reviews.author: iMetalG5

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer to replace a Lexmark Z65. The Lexmark brand is crap it cost twice as much as the Canon and the quality wasn't even half as good. Canon puts Lexmark to shame. I tossed my Lexmark in the dumpster, the acdc adapter had melted anyway and I wasn't about to replace it. This printer is so much faster quieter and has better text quality, not to mention the beautiful pictures it prints out even with the canon software. I can't wait to try it out with Photoshop. I need to buy more canon glossy photo paper. The cost of the printer after $20 rebate on (...)was $45 dollars. Worth every Penny and then some.
customer_reviews.author: Marisol Estela

customer_reviews.title: sanlis
customer_reviews.text: Bought this printer last month and I just love it! I use it for printing photos and my daughter uses it for book reports and printing documents which it does very quickly and quietly. Printed lots of photos on the 4x6 glossy canon paper and they came out extremely well. Cannot tell the difference from previous ones developed at store. Also used Kodak's soft gloss paper and that worked well too. I have printed around 100 pictures in 4x6 as well as 8x11 and the ink is still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: lisasand

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy in the price range
customer_reviews.text: the printer is great for the price. Set up was easy. Fast text printing and relatively fast for photos. Not a heavy printer user but I wanted good quality prints and bigger ink tanks. I uninstalled the software, as it was not that useful. It over crops on borderless and border prints for me. Got a great deal at Staples for $79.99. Target sells IP2000 for $79 with the two little ink containers that run out too soon (had S200 Canon with them before). Use the Canon Photo paper for best photo results. I don't have a Picbridge camera so can't comment on that feature.
customer_reviews.author: C Cargo

customer_reviews.title: Better Printers Out There
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer over two years ago for my office. It has been printing fine, but is a very slow printer. It takes a good two or three minutes just to warm up. Canon support was good to help when I had an issue with it last year when it was still under warranty. I would recommend finding a newer model, and still sticking with Canon since I've had better experiences with them than HP. HP seems to install a lot of unneeded software on your computer.
customer_reviews.author: Jared M.

customer_reviews.title: Great printer with "hidden features"
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an ip3000 when my i550 died (thought I was saving money using generic inks, and it cost me a new printer). Photo printouts are superb (8x10's look fantastic!) Speedy, decent black prints. Two things of note: it is possible to "modify" this printer to print on printable CD and DVD discs! Also, you can save money by printing in grayscale - but you *must* use the wizard to get blac-ink only in draft mode. And yes, it is fast!
customer_reviews.author: Benny S

customer_reviews.title: nice printer
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice printer. I use it for school most of the time. I never tried to print a picture (cheaper at Wal-Mart only 19c a copy).fast, and quiet. also the ink is cheap not link Lexmark, and HP.I emailed Amazon to match the price with newegg.com no luck at all newegg is selling it for 62.95+ 2.95 shipping(right now 6.95)final price after mail in is 42.95
customer_reviews.author: MJ28

customer_reviews.title: Great printer and works fine.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe some folks have had problems, but not me. I run Windows 2000. I installed the printer according to the instructions and all worked perfectly. Using the included photo paper, I printed a photo at highest print quality. It looks as good as one could ask for. I don't know what went wrong with some of the other people, but I could not ask for a better printer. I am 100% satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Will Nance

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer for what you pay
customer_reviews.text: Excellent printer. Lot of features and very fast speed. Much better than my old HP 930c. Hopefully, it will be cheaper in long term, too, because Canon cartridges are cheaper than HP in general. I also bought Canon iP4000. That one is even better. Compare the two (iP3000 and iP4000), iP4000 has better black color on photo(same setting and same photos). Much darker and more saturated because of the extra black (3e)color cartridge for photo printing. 3e gives the photo more saturation and more of the professional photo developing look. Most people probably will be satisfy with iP3000. It probably save you more money in long term with iP3000. However, if you want better photo quality, then go for iP4000.
customer_reviews.author: T. K. K. HO

customer_reviews.title: What a brilliant printer. I have had mine 12 years
customer_reviews.text: What a brilliant printer. I have had mine 12 years..only one easy obtain printhead change needed in that time. Still works like a charm
customer_reviews.author: Peterg123

customer_reviews.title: The Secret to Canon Photo Printing
customer_reviews.text: I tried out my canon with the photo printing. If you use non canon paper it is okay printing. If you use Canon photo plus glossy or pro (it is worth the money for fantastic special pictures) the pictures are better than the ones that I picked up from my 35mm camera. I found out that canon ink is formulated to match canon paper. So, buy the paper, it is worth it for great pictures!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn N.

customer_reviews.title: Canon's dont last
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd Canon printer I have bought in just over 3 years and it is the last time I will ever buy one. At just over one year of owning each printer, I had different problems with each one, too expensive to repair, so ended up just buying another. But after this one, I will never buy another Canon. They work well for about a year, but after that they quit running. I used to have high regards for Canon products and I always bought one because of the multiple inket refills but it is worthless to me if I have to buy another every year and just after the warranty runs out.
customer_reviews.author: P. Kintz

customer_reviews.title: Great printer, no complaints.
customer_reviews.text: This printer does an excellent job, esp with high-quality paper, on documents and an equally fine job on photos. I have used it to turn several so-so color photos into beautiful bordered B&W prints. Worked with my PC and now works with my Mac, no problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: S. Shee

customer_reviews.title: workhorse
customer_reviews.text: We've had this printer since '04 and it's still going strong. Despite having to have pretzels dug out of it! Love the individual ink tanks. Prints photos OK, but not it's strong-suit.
customer_reviews.author: Librarocks

customer_reviews.title: This Printer is the Best!
customer_reviews.text: This printer is so hot! I like the gray design because it looks very sleek and stylish. The picture quality though is the best thing about this printer! The quality is amazing and so clear, by far the best I have ever seen from any photo printer! The past reviewers are right, some of the pictures far exceed the quality found in photo shops. I would definitely recommnend this buy for anyone. Especially with the $70 rebate you can recieve if you buy a powershot digital camera! I love this printer, it is truly the best one i've ever had!
customer_reviews.author: Summer Em

customer_reviews.title: Fine Printer When New but WILL NOT LAST!
customer_reviews.text: I should have learned my lesson with my first Canon printer. Unfortunately I replaced it with this ip3000 model. It will not last! The paper feed mechanism will soon go bad. Mine fed paper in at an angle, grabbing it on the right side and ripping it apart. After too many hours of research and dickering, I simple annihilated it into with the largest hammer I have! I must have thrown over fifty pieces into the garbage. The problems with this printer are well documented on the internet despite positive feedback here on Amazon. I will NEVER buy another Canon product again. NEVER!!!
customer_reviews.author: Roberto BTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Ink Hungry Vampire
customer_reviews.text: The print quality of this low priced printer is great. But, and this is a BIG but, it sucks ink like a blood thirsty vampire, it seems to drain all ink colors reguardless of weather the picture requires it or not seeming to evaporate without cause. I stocked up on some budget ink cartridges from an online store and the amount of printing I've done compared to how many ink cartridges I've used make this printer anything but economical.
customer_reviews.author: tman7

customer_reviews.title: Very good printer
customer_reviews.text: Color photos come out with different color. They look like with more contrast. I wish the auto feeder could support at least 2 types of input such as photo papers and letter size papers. It prints very good jobs except for the photos.
customer_reviews.author: Felix Chang

customer_reviews.title: excellent quality printer
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this printer to go with my new Canon Powershot S500. Love it! I've purchased matte, satin & glossy paper to compare. The satin look and feel the same as what I've received from film processed pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Better than my "expensive" printers
customer_reviews.text: As the owner of two HP printers (deskjet 932 and all-in-one 4215) I was blown away by the Pixma 3000. I needed a "cheap" printer with "cheap" inks so I bought the Pixma. I was astounded by the speed and print quality (photo and document) which surpasses my HP printers. The Pixma is a little big, but I like the design. I have not tried the direct print feature yet. My last two Canon purchases (this printer and the SD200 camera) have been fantastic and exceeded my expectations. Thanks Canon.
customer_reviews.author: P. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase, price, printer!
customer_reviews.text: This printer was not only a great price, but it does a fantastic printing job. Very easy to set up and prints photos with ease and excellent quality. Don't miss your chance to pick this up at the very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Montana gal

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I just received this printer a week ago and couldn't be happier. Text quality excellent and very decent photo printing. Fast compared to my HP 680 and quiet too. Double sided (duplex) printing works suprisingly well. 4 ink tank system a great idea to reduce ink costs. Setup very easy. Amazing performance given how inexpensive a printer it is.
customer_reviews.author: S. Beal

customer_reviews.title: Much better than Epson
customer_reviews.text: Had a Epson C80 printer for 3 years. In my opinion the Epson is a crumby product with crumby design. I got the Canon when the Epson refused to print at all. I should have chucked the Epson much earlier as the Canon is SOOOO much better (won't try to print when output tray closed, has 150 sheet enclosed paper compartment as well as top loader, prints both sides, ...)
customer_reviews.author: shouldBstudying

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Printer
customer_reviews.text: After checking reviews on several low priced printers I decided on purchasing the Canon PIXMA IP 3000. I cant say enough good things about this printer. I was hoping for something that printed average photographs. I was stunned to see how good of picture was printed on this printer. Definitely the best I have seen for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ystonefalls

customer_reviews.title: Excellent machine
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous but discontinued, best for recharging cartidges where it is allowed like in my country
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo Gonzalez Vite

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye Epson Hello Canon
customer_reviews.text: My Epson C44 died after 14 months light use.Got the Canon ip3000.Looks great,sounds great,prints clear and fast.The difference is amazing and it's well built and cheap.Sensibly they have avoided the all in one colour cartridges and those wretched chips .Get one now and enjoy decent prints<sorry Epson>
customer_reviews.author: Mark Andrews

customer_reviews.title: A STEAL for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer now for about 4 months and I haven't had any problems with it at all. The one thing that I found kindof weird about mine is that it gives me A LOT of prior notice that one of the ink tanks is running low. [...] I love this printer. It's great for the price. Pictures turn out well too. YAY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Creel

customer_reviews.title: Duplex (2 / double sided) printing a boon!
customer_reviews.text: After struggling with a jamming HP printer and their unhelpful support, I decided to buy a new one. I wanted to also have duplex. Techadvice.com pointed me to this one (thanks guys!): it works flawless straight out of the box, and has a good printer progress window! 100% value for money!
customer_reviews.author: F. A. Clasener

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for only some people
customer_reviews.text: This is a sweet printer in most ways. The paper handling is great, the image quality is great, it is fast, and the ink is a resonable price. The downside? If you are thinking about using Linux even a little, ignore Canon Printers. The support is nonexistant. (I recently switched, and everything works great EXCEPT this printer. My HP works fine)
customer_reviews.author: John Jamieson

customer_reviews.title: Cannon ip3000 pixima
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer, it was shipped when the seller said, sent to me on time, and a wonderful printer. The speed of the printer is pretty good, the space of the printer is about the same as my old one. I have not read all the information on this printer yet. I just got it but so far it prints just wonderful and a nice speed.
customer_reviews.author: Shawna Walden

customer_reviews.title: Don't throw them away!
customer_reviews.text: If the printhead on ANY printer clogs up, do NOT through it out. You can soak the printhead in about 1/8 to 1/4 inch of Windex Window Cleaner overnight, and they are as good as new. Sometimes it might take two nights. A clog can happen if when your very first start using refill inks, or let the printer set too long (Epson). Fixed several printers this way now that people WERE going to trash! I do not buy anything but Canon now. The Windex trick works on the Canon printhead also.
customer_reviews.author: isepiq

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Photo quaity on Photo Paper
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from i860 to IP3000 rcently. I was glad to see its speed when printed B/W paper. After couple of days when i printed the photo. It was fast as compare to i860 but the quality was very poor. It is completly waste to put money in it for photo printer. Canon has degraded the quality here to boost the sale of ip4000 and ip5000 printers. Printer design seems good, B/W Printing quality and speed are good. I give 0 (1) star because its name is photo printer and it is not good in phto printing.
customer_reviews.author: Kirats

customer_reviews.title: canon pixma rocks
customer_reviews.text: Saves paper due to the double sided printing...but hang on..it takes a while to process. Hey but if you're in a hurry it will print one side lightning speed. Pictures look great...but make sure you preview...it doesn't work with all picture programs. But for as cheap as it was [...]...soooo... worth it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chonn Ng

customer_reviews.title: Landfill
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for a couple of months of sparse use. Then, it would not be recognized by my computer no matter how many times I tried to tighten the connections and reinstall. Now, it won't even power up. Completely dead. Thank you for wasting my money and worse, creating more useless garbage. A shame.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. M

customer_reviews.title: The little engine that could....then DIDN'T!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this printer for probablly a year now and now I'm shopping for a new one!! Why can't Canon get it in their head to put the print head on the ink cartridge itself like HP does (who's printers I'm now reviewing)...then maybe you wouldn't have the problem of your print head wearing out and clogging like I did. Oh and did I mention it costs about $85 for a new print head,...yeah that's what I said! Don't get me wrong...the printer did great for the time I had it...excellent prints and everything but to only last a year (if it's even been that long)...I'm quite disappointed. So my search is on.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael M.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money!
customer_reviews.text: I had this printer less than a year and used it primarily for printing documents. My daughter was born on November 1st and I tried printing pictures on photo paper and the color didn't print right. So I thought it was time for new color ink. Bought Staples brand photo ink, about $50.00,(replaced all colors, go figure there is no such thing as photo yellow) and it still doesn't print properly. Now I am out $50.00 in ink. I took out and cleaned the print head and it still sucks. I am very disappointed in this printer and will probably never buy another Canon again!
customer_reviews.author: PissedOffCustomer

customer_reviews.title: GOOD PRINTER FROM CANON
customer_reviews.text: Have had this printer for a year or so now. It is very good, the cartridges are very easy to refill. Has individual color ink tanks unlike HP printers. So it is very easy to work with. Makes nice color pictures and good B&W printing, fast. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: William A. Beers

customer_reviews.title: Great double siding printer
customer_reviews.text: This is my low cost travel printer that double sides like a champ. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to be a printer for documents and such, that said I was amazed at its photo quality printing.
customer_reviews.author: MarkBelhorn

customer_reviews.title: HIghly Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I had a Canon Bubble jet printer years ago and really enjoyed it, but this printer is terrible. Paper jams constantly at the ejection point. Printing more than one page is an ordeal. Not recommended at all. Print quality is fine, but it's too much hassle even to get to that point.
customer_reviews.author: S. Axtell

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Photo Printer
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed by how well it did a scanned photo on photo paper right from the box.
customer_reviews.author: C. Miller

customer_reviews.title: VERY NICE PRINTER
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the printer. With the rebate I was able to upgrade to this printer from the 1500 for very little difference. Installation and set-up was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory G. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Canon Rebate Scam
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this printer along with an iBook G4 expecting to receive a $70 rebate for the printer. Well, it took an extra month to receive my printer. Then, they sent me only $20 in rebate. I called them and asked for assistance but none of their departments have communication with eachother. I've already re-faxed my information twice but the 'override' department can't get those documents from the rebate department. So now I have to spend another $5 faxing the same five pages to the same company. Don't expect good service from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Newman

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't install the driver
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't install the driver on my laptop. I searched on the internet and asked the Canon company service through phone, so far I still couldn't install it yet. It seemed that a lot of people had similar problem with Canon printers (maybe with other brands too). So the print quality is poor probably because I couldn't adjust it (the printer is supposed to be calibrated after installing the driver). The process to make the installation work was really frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: DS

product_meta.title: Canon PIXMA iP3000 Photo Printer
product_meta.description:
Box contents include: PIXMA iP3000 Photo Printer, Print Head, Ink Tanks(black, cyan, magenta, yellow), 4" x 6" glossy photo paper sample pack, power cord, documentation kit and User Guide CD-ROM The Canon PIXMA iP3000 Color Photo Printer delivers high-performance printing with flexible paper handling. It offers high speed printing at up to 22 ppm in black and up to 15 ppm in color. Four individual ink tanks help reduce waste and can save you money, while printing your color photos. The iP3000 can print borderless 4" x 6" photgraphs in about 36 seconds at a maximum 4800 x 1200 color dpi, with droplets as small as 2 picoliters. This means high-intensity, high-resolution photos and graphics, with the look and feel of traditional photographs. Direct photo printing from PictBridge compatible digital cameras & DV camcorders Dual paper path with built-in 2 sided printing Paper sizes accepted - Letter, Legal, 4 x 6, 5 x 7 & U.S. #10 envelopes Ink Compatibility - BCI-3e black, BCI-6C cyan, BCI-6M magenta, BCI-6Y yellow tanks Droplet Size - 2-5 picoliters Connects with Windows(98 and up) or Mac OS (9.x and up) machines through USB or printer port (cable not incl.) Software includes printer drivers, Easy-PhotoPrint, Easy-WebPrint, PhotoRecord, Electronic User's Guide, Photo Application Guide & Electronic Registration Physical Dimensions(WxDxH) - 16.5 x 10.8 x 6.8 Weight - 11.0 lbs.

AMAZON.COM
Amazon.com Product Description High speed, sharp resolution, and economical ink refills: Could you ask for more in a home printer? The Canon PIXMA ip3000 is designed with 1,600 nozzles that produce tiny 2-picoliter droplets, resulting in finely detailed images that are worthy of saving in your family photo albums. Pigment-based inks insure colors will stay true, and the prints are resistant to water, fading, and smudges. 

 Precision Color Distribution Technology
Unlike other systems, nozzle configuration in Bubble Jet printers is simple, so it is easier to make them smaller and more dense. Using its superior semiconductor manufacturing technology, Canon has succeeded in developing an ultrahigh-precision, multinozzle print head. The problem of color inconsistency has been solved by positioning a mirror-image line of 128 nozzles (600 dpi pitch for each color) at a half-pitch offset from the existing line. This configuration also provides the added advantage of enabling high-resolution printing at 1,200 dpi. 

 Easy-PhotoPrint v3.0
While most photo-editing software applications will brighten the entire image, Easy-PhotoPrint 3.0 accurately detects the subject's face and adjusts the skin to the optimum tone. Brighten dark faces caused by bright backgrounds. Choose from one-click automatic to correct the entire image all at once, or manual to correct just a selected area. 

 

Before
After
 Easy-PhotoPrint 3.0 also lets you select and print any image on your PC, perfectly trim images, correct images using lab-quality retouching features, correct red-eye, smooth facial lines and skin tone, sharpen faces, remove blemishes, and print in a variety of sizes and layouts. 

 Exif Print Technology
Exif 2.2 is the worldwide printer independent standard for digital image processing. Under Exif 2.2, the digital still camera can record data tags for specific camera settings and functions such as whether the flash was on or off, if the camera was in landscape, portrait or night scene mode, etc. Referencing some or all of this information, an Exif Print compatible application can process digital camera images intelligently based on specific camera settings and the shooting environment. 

 

 

 With resolution up to 600 x 600 dpi black and 4,800 x 1,200 dpi color, your office documents or school reports will look as good as your photos. Built-in two-sided printing reduces your paper costs and allows you truly professional design options. 

 


This printer can connect directly to select digital cameras. Learn more about PictBridge. Top speeds of 22 ppm black and 15 ppm color (draft mode) will have your pages in hand in just a few seconds; a borderless 4-by-6-inch photo can take as little as 36 seconds--as fast as those old instant cameras, but with much better quality. Thanks to the PictBridge-compatible direct print port, you can connect your digital camera and churn out photos while bypassing your computer system.  The ip3000 is compatible with Mac and Windows operating systems, and requires only a USB cable to get it up and running (cable not included). Canon provides a one-year warranty covering parts and service.

 What's in the Box
PIXMA iP3000 photo printer, PIXMA iP3000 print head, BCI-3eBk black ink tank, BCI-6C cyan ink tank, BCI-6M magenta ink tank, BCI-6Y yellow ink tank, Canon Photo Paper Plus Glossy 4x6 sample pack, power cord, documentation kit, setup software and user's guide on CD-ROM; printer cable not included
